** translation of describtion **

Second World War. Allied forces in the snow at the front in Greece.

* Note: According to the previous post these are Italian soldiers.

comment.author: 17914608@N06
comment._content: How can you tell they are italians? By the helmet shape?

comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content:
Exactly.  Plus the rifle, and the cannon.

I'm curious as to what these pictures are doing in the Dutch archives.  Were they German pictures left behind, or sent for local publication?

comment.author: 14673419@N00
comment._content: The photos were distributed in Axis conquered Europe to support their cause, an by this way ended up in Dutch photo archives. So indeed could never be Allied troops.

comment.author: 7454080@N04
comment._content:
Axis occupation of Greece during World War II
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
The Axis occupation of Greece during World War II  began in April 1941 after the German and Italian invasion of Greece, and was carried out together with Bulgarian forces. The Occupation lasted until the German withdrawal from the mainland in October 1944. In some cases however, such as in Crete and other islands, German garrisons remained in control until May or even June 1945.

comment._content: Does today generation  feel the power of the world war 2?

comment.author: 14626411@N02
comment._content:
Which power?
I hope todays generation has the ability to learn from mistakes in the past not to do theese awful things again!

comment.author: 48702688@N05
comment._content:
I also confirm they are Italians, easily identifiable by their Modello 33 steel helmets and by the short barrel Moschetto 91 carabine with the folding bayonet (issued to artillery and cavalry units in place of the long barreled M91 rifle).
Incidentally, I used the very same Modello 33 steel helmet during military service in 1997-98.

comment.author: 29998366@N02
comment._content: Thanks everyone for helping us to identify the nationality of these soldiers!
